column4: i installed kubuntu base and its all ugly and none of the shortcuts are in the menu and half the butons don't work, there's a minimal theme and it crashes, I think it may be because when i installed kubuntu-base using synaptic apt tried to get some stuff from teh internet and couldn't
tgjw how do i set my proxy settings?
no, its apt, but it jstu waits a while then coes back to a prompt
System > Preferences > Network proxy
don't patronise me
? sorry, didn't follow previous questions. No patronizing here, no, no ;)
what app did you want to change/setup proxy for ?

when i installed kubuntu-base it tried to get some files from the internet in the postinstall but couldn't, and so i tried apt-get and it doesn't seem to b configured, so i'm sat ina decrepit version of kde, no themes, no buttons working, no shortcuts etc
can you boot in safe mode ?
(rescue, sorry)
i can boot and get apps unning, in fact i can give up and go back to gnome, i just wanted to try out kde, and its not impressing me so far,
I would completely remove kde and reinstall it.
I know in synaptic you can, so apt-get in command line definitely provides for it
I can use synaptic
sometimes depending on what you did at your first rty, it may have installed *some* dpeendencies, not all thus the unstable result
which version ? 5.10 ? if so, in the menu Places > Connect to server > Windows Share you should have a field for the domaine
I do that and then when i restart the field is reset, when i set it it works for that session, but its a bit of a faff
is there any way to set it from the command prompt so i can automount it at boot?
search synaptic for "smb"... let me see
i have smbfs n everything installed, i can mount the drive, i just need to set the domain, but it resets to a blank field every time i restart the computer so i have to set it again, then it works
there's a CLI for samba, smbclient is the package
can't help much more
check Google for ubuntu+samba+automount
